thread.title: Giants promote cornerback Brandon McGee from practice squad, waive tight end Jerome Cunningham
thread.title_full: Giants promote cornerback Brandon McGee from practice squad, waive tight end Jerome Cunningham

author: James Kratch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Giants promote cornerback Brandon McGee from practice squad, waive tight end Jerome Cunningham
text:
Comments 
EAST RUTHERFORD â€” Faced with a dearth of depth at cornerback, the Giants have promoted Brandon McGee from the practice squad and waived tight end Jerome Cunningham, two individuals with knowledge of the move confirmed to NJ Advance Media. 
McGee was signed to the Giants' practice squad on Thursday . McGee, a Miami product, was a fifth-round pick by the Rams in the 2013 NFL Draft. McGee has played in 17 regular season games in his career. 
He played in 15 games in 2013, then missed most of last season with a foot injury. He was briefly on the Rams' active roster this season, as well as their practice squad. 
The Giants needed to make a move at cornerback, where they have been hit hard with injuries over the past two weeks. Starting cornerback Prince Amukamara is out 2-4 weeks with a partially torn pectoral muscle , and slot cornerback Trumaine McBride has been limited by a groin injury, as well as illness. 
PLUS : JPP is on the way back to Giants soon for a check-up 
McBride was listed as questionable for Monday night's game against the Eagles , leaving the Giants with just three healthy cornerbacks in Dominique Rodgers-Cromartie, Jayron Hosley and Trevin Wade before the addition of McGee. 
Cunningham earned a spot as the Giants' third tight end coming out of training camp, but he had been inactive for all but one game this season, both as a healthy scratch and while dealing with a knee injury. Cunningham has one catch for three yards this year, and was wearing a large knee brace during practice this past week. 
The Giants now have only two tight ends on the active roster in Larry Donnell and Will Tye, and none on the practice squad, so they will likely be adding a tight end in some capacity over the next few days. It was not immediately clear whether the Giants would potentially re-sign Cunningham if he clears waivers, a source told NJ Advance Media.
